content.question: Particle X moves along the positive x-axis so that its position at time t ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = 5t3 − 9t2 + 7. (a) Is particle X moving toward the left or toward the right at time t = 1? Give a reason for your answer.

frqParts.text: Particle X moves along the positive x-axis so that its position at time t ≥ 0 is given by x(t) = 5t3 − 9t2 + 7. (a) Is particle X moving toward the left or toward the right at time t = 1? Give a reason for your answer.
(b) At what time t ≥ 0 is particle X farthest to the left? Justify your answer.

(c) A second particle, Y, moves along the positive y-axis so that its position at time t is given by y(t) = 7t + 3. At any time t, t ≥ 0, the origin and the positions of the particles X and Y are the vertices of a triangle in the first quadrant. Find the rate of change of the area of the triangle at time t = 1. Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
